intro: Lastrea coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features fleshy, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, yellowish flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring or summer. Due to its unique appearance and adaptations, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid and semi-arid environments.
